topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5505b34263687273ea140800#post_5505b34263687273ea140800
Are the new Ghost in the Shell movies any good? Although Matoko isn't a robot. She's a cyborg.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5505b3a66368724281d91200#post_5505b3a66368724281d91200
They're decent.

They're by no means a masterpiece, but they focus more on a underlying story rather than episodic in nature.

The new movies are about a character called "firestarter".  For those of you that don't know a theoretical fire sale in cyber security is a situation in which is a blanket attack on the infrastructure of a nation to achieve a goal.  If I had to take a guess the new movies are talking about current the current cyber security situation in the world rather than more into the theoretical.

Basically imagine if you took out all the filler from stand alone complex.

topics.body:
So Steven Universe has fifty episodes as I'm typing this. Each episode is around fifteen minutes long. That means it would take seven hundred fifty  minutes to completely catch up.
That's twelve and a half hours.
